definitions.definition: A thorough search, usually resulting in disorder.
definitions.example: Have a rummage through the attic and see if you can find anything worth selling.

definitions.definition: A disorganized collection of miscellaneous objects; a jumble.
A place or room for the stowage of cargo in a ship.
The act of stowing cargo; the pulling and moving about of packages incident to close stowage.
To arrange (cargo, goods, etc.) in the hold of a ship; to move or rearrange such goods.
To search a vessel for smuggled goods.
definitions.example: After the long voyage, the customs officers rummaged the ship.

definitions.definition: To search something thoroughly and with disregard for the way in which things were arranged.
definitions.example: She rummaged her purse in search of the keys.
